fields.name: minpos
fields.description: Set a lower bound on the number of positive examples to be covered by an acceptable clause. If the best clause covers positive examples below this number, then it is not added to the current theory. This can be used to prevent Aleph from adding ground unit clauses to the theory (by setting the value to 2).

fields.name: noise
fields.description: Set an upper bound on the number of negative examples allowed to be covered by an acceptable clause.

fields.name: clauselength
fields.description: Sets upper bound on number of literals in an acceptable clause.

fields.name: depth
fields.description: Sets an upper bound on the proof depth to which theorem-proving proceeds.

fields.name: evalfn
fields.description: Sets the evaluation function for a search.

fields.name: i
fields.description: Set upper bound on layers of new variables.

fields.name: language
fields.description: Specifies the number of occurences of a predicate symbol in any clause (inf or > 0).

fields.name: max_features
fields.description: Sets an upper bound on the maximum number of boolean features constructed by searching for good clauses (inf or > 0).

fields.name: RSD
fields.description: Relational subgroup discovery by Zelezny et al.

fields.name: clauselength
fields.description:
An integer specifying the maximum length of a feature
body.

fields.name: depth
fields.description:
An integer specifying the maximum depth of variables
found in a feature body.

fields.name: negation
fields.description:
One of now, later, none.
now: To features generated by featurize.pl, process.pl
will also add their versions where the complete body is
negated. (Negations of individual literals can be done by
suitably defining background knowledge predicates.)
later: tells the program that an inducer capable of
negating features will be applied on the propositionalized
representation. This influences functions described below.

fields.name: min_coverage
fields.description:
An integer mc. All features (including negated versions)
covering fewer than mc instances will be discarded.
However, if negation is later (see above), a feature
is discarded only if both (a) coverage thereof and (b) the
coverage of its negated version are smaller than mc.

fields.name: filtering
fields.description:
One of true, false. If true, each feature will be discarded
if (a) it covers the same set of instances as some previously
constructed feature, or (b) it covers all instances.

fields.name: arff
fields.description: arff file of the propositionalized data

fields.name: SDM-Aleph
fields.description:
SDM-Aleph web service.
    
    Inputs:
        - examples: str, a .tab dataset or a list of pairs
        - mapping : str, a mapping between examples and ontological terms,
        - ontologies : a list of {'ontology' : str} dicts
        - relations : a list of {'relation' : str} dicts
        - posClassVal : str, if the data is class-labeled, this is the target class,
        - cutoff : int, if the data is ranked, this is the cutoff value for splitting it into two classes,
        - minPos : int >= 1, minimum number of true positives per rule
        - noise : int > 0, false positives allowed per rule
        - clauseLen : int >= 1, number of predicates per clause,
        - dataFormat : str, legal values are 'tab' or 'list'
    Output:
        - str, the induced theory.
    
    @author: Anze Vavpetic, 2011 <anze.vavpetic@ijs.si>

fields.name: mapping
fields.description: mapping from ontology concepts to examples

fields.name: SDM-SEGS
fields.description:
SDM-SEGS web service.
    
    Inputs:
        - inputData: str, a .tab dataset or a (pythonish) list of pairs
        - interactions: str, list of interacting examples,
        - mapping : str, a mapping between examples and ontological terms,
        - ont1-4 : str, ontologies in OWL (legacy=false), or in SEGS's format (legacy=true)
        - generalTerms : str, terms that are too general (each in new line),
        - legacy : bool, turns on SEGS mode,
        - posClassVal : str, if the data is class-labeled, this is the target class,
        - cutoff : int, if the data is ranked, this is the cutoff value for splitting it into two classes,
        - wracc_k : int, number of times an example can be covered when selecting with WRAcc,
        - minimalSetSize : int, minimum number of covered examples,
        - maxNumTerms : int, maximum number of conjunctions in one rule,
        - maxReported : int, number of returned rules,
        - maximalPvalue : float, maximum p-value of a returned rule,
        - weightFisher, weightGSEA, weightPAGE : float, weights for corresponding score functions; makes sense only if legacy = false,
        - dataFormat : str, legal values are 'tab' or 'list'
    Output:
        - json dictionary encoding the discovered rules.
        
    Note: See http://kt.ijs.si/software/SEGS/ for legacy format specification.
    
    @author: Anze Vavpetic, 2011 <anze.vavpetic@ijs.si>

fields.name: Maximum size of features (applies to HiFi and Poly algs)
fields.description: Maximum size of features (applies to HiFi and Poly algs)

fields.name: Covered class (applies only to the RelF algorithm)
fields.description: Covered class (applies only to the RelF algorithm)

fields.name: feature n-grams
fields.description: Construct words out of  upto n features

fields.name: Document corpus
fields.description: Result of wordification for main target table
